name: Dripping Springs Resort

reviews.title: Great cabin right by the river
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights in the Encantado cabin with three children ages 14, 2 and 1. There was plenty of space for everyone and the decor was perfect for a mountain retreat. Our two year old loved the river access and spent many hours standing ankle deep and skipping stones.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent a weekend here in the Pinewood cabin as a welcome home from Afghanistan present. The cabin seemed older than most others in the area, but was newly renovated and clean. It was great having a private hot tub. The best thing about Dripping Springs resort was the layout of the property... most other resorts had their cabins just stacked on top of each other with no privacy. Not here, we had a nice "yard" that went right down to river with plenty of trees and bushes. We didn't even know that there were other cabins with people in them. We would definitely go back to Dripping Springs Resort.
reviews.title: Romantic Getaway

reviews.text: Dripping Springs resort has beautiful, rustic, stylized accommodations, reasonably priced. The staff were helpful and abundantly accommodating. They even declined to charge us for damages and lost items. The location was ideally close to the town of Estes Park, but removed enough to allow for visitations by local wildlife. Two elk wandered through our backyard one morning, and my children were delighted by constant sightings of chipmunks and rabbits. I can't recommend this resort highly enough!
reviews.title: Terrific!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just spent a week here to celebrate our 30th anniversary. Having stayed at Dripping Springs before, we knew what to expect- private hot tub, river view, tranquility, great location & gracious hosts! We were not dissappointed! Owners Janie & Oliver have made this a perfect oasis from hectic city life. Breakfast here is not to be missed, from Janie's cooking to John's entertaining conversation ( resident comedian ) it's a good start to your day! Renting a scooter from ZootScoot and heading to the RMNP is one of my favorite ways to spend a day or make your way down the path after breakfast to a hammock by the river and relax.
reviews.title: Love this place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were doing some hiking in Rocky Mountain National Park and stayed at Dripping Springs for several days in early June, and we had an absolutely wonderful time. We stayed in the Angler's Retreat (which we highly recommend!), and the private hot tub overlooking the river absolutely made our trip. We thought the location was perfect, as it was easy to access RMNP and was quiet because it isn't right in town. The owners and operators of Dripping Springs were very welcoming, and Janey makes a killer breakfast each morning. I whole heartedly recommend Dripping Springs for anyone traveling to Estes Park. It was fantastic in all ways!
reviews.title: What a wonderful place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights in the Alamo cabin. It is a wonderful 1-bedroom cottage with direct, private river access, a small but very functional kitchen and a nice living room. The highlight is the private porch with 2-person Jacuzzi. Very convenient to Estes Park but remote enough to get out of town. Would DEFINITELY stay there again!
reviews.title: Great getaway stay

reviews.text: My husband and I have been to Estes Park several times, but this was our first time to stay at the Dripping Springs with one of our sons and his family. We loved it, they loved it! Janie, Oliver and John treated our family like we were old friends; all very friendly. The Encatada Cabin exceeded our expectations, and staying right on the Big Thompson River was heaven! The guys could step out the door and fly fish! Kirk's Fly Shop said that area has the best fly fishing spot. Yes, they did catch some trout! It's beautiful, relaxing with a private hot tub to unwind in. The weather could not have been more perfect! Being close to town and the Rocky Mountain Park, sightseeing was easy and fun. We all decided we will be back again! Thank you Janie, Oliver and John!
reviews.title: Dripping Springs - Rustic, Relaxing & Awesome!

reviews.text: It is one of the greatest place's the food is amazing, the beds are well made I love it!
reviews.title: Dripping Springs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been going to Dripping Springs B&B for the last 12 years. Every year there is something new to see. The rooms are always clean and the decor changes from year to year. Janie and Oliver are some of the friendliest people around. I can go there and just relax and do nothing if I want to. If I want to go on a picnic Janie will fix us a lunch to take with us. Since finding Dripping Springs I have not gone to any other B&B in Estes Park. We will be coming back for another visit before the season is over.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: This is our favorite place to stay in Estes. Janie, Oliver, and John always make us feel welcome. It's a great place to relax and unwind after a stressful week in Denver.
reviews.title: Charming alternative to a hotel.

reviews.text: This was our second visit to Dripping Springs and we couldn't wait to get back here. We'd stayed in the B&B rooms before but we wanted to have a little place to ourselves and the Willow was just what we were looking for. It's like something out of a Disney movie- What with the twinkle lights, the jacuzzi on the back deck, the wildlife (bunny in the yard and marmots across the way), the open windows onto the woods and river sounds. Paradise! I didn't call in enough time to have it our whole stay, but Janie managed to work it out for us that we could. She is amazing! There isn't any wish that she can't fulfill! We had champagne and a cake waiting in our frig when we arrived- It was our 30th anniversary.Cabins don't get breakfasts but with enough notice she can work you into the B&B one. And you owe it to yourself to sample at least one of her breakfasts. I've never seen so much different delicious food on one table before- You name it, she provides it. I've been at B&B's where there just doesn't seem to be enough to go around-NEVER the case here! There's always plenty for all.
reviews.title: "Couldn't get any better"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also fly fish and they have THE BEST private water on the Big Thompson- bar none. We always catch plenty of gorgeous fish without having to worry about others fishing there first. No crowds- Love it!
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay!

reviews.text: Janie, Oliver and John are some of the THE MOST welcoming people I've ever dealt with. You're like a member of the family when you stay here. I HIGHLY recommend you stay here on your next trip to Estes park. You won't be sorry!
reviews.title: A slice of heaven.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just got married and found this place. We were actually upgraded to a bigger cabin (the Dancing Bear cabin) for free because of someone staying longer than us. We really enjoyed how well kept the place is. Everything smelled nice and looked great. The location was even better. We were right next to the river and were able to enjoy some relaxing time in some outdoor chairs right beside it. The hot tub added more to the relaxation department and we took advantage of that every night. Janie was a very sweet lady and made sure that we were well taken care of. We hope to have the chance to go back again. It's definitely a beautiful place to stay!
reviews.title: Relaxing, fun getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my family spent two nights in their two bedroom bigger cabin, located right off the river. Very clean, quiet, and cozy. We had a private hot tub on our back porch, and an awesome fire pit for s'mores down by the river. A 10 min drive to the shopping in Estes Parks. Can't wait to go back! Will definetly be staying at Dripping Springs again!
reviews.title: Great Getaway

reviews.text: We stayed at Dripping Springs Resort in late August 2011 in the Phoenix Cabin -- a family of four. When staying in the cabins, you do not have the opportunity to enjoy the breakfast that the innkeepers serve, so our interactions with them were limited to check-in and out. They are friendly, helpful and hardworking innkeepers!
reviews.title: A bit like staying at Grandma's condo...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My rating is not higher simply because we were a little disappointed in the Phoenix cabin. First because it is attached to the Thunderbird...it is one building with two units. The other unit was occupied by another quiet couple, but it was a bit uncomfortable for our family hanging out on the balcony chatting with the neighbors about 3 feet away on the other side of a wooden privacy panel hearing every word. This building would work well for two families traveling together or a group, since you could open up the door between the porches and hand out together.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem in the Rockies

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Second, the unit sits close to Hwy 34 and high above the river and the firepit and hot tub area has no river view. I probably could've figured this out from the website photos, but it was a short walk down a steep path to the river and it would've been nicer to have views from the unit of the river. Additionally, with no AC (understandable in that climate) and the windows wide open, noise from the road woke us in the morning (we live in a completely quiet, no-street-noise neighborhood so we're just not used to hearing cars).
reviews.title: City Boy Loved Dripping Springs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Finally, and most importantly, while we enjoyed having the space to spread out, the furnishing and decor were dated and older. From looking at the website, they appear to have updated the living room decor with new paneling and some other "southwest" elements and that may help. However, when we were there less than a year ago, the bedroom furniture, window treatments, the lamps, the nicknacks, art of the walls, the clean but worn carpeting, thin polyester bedspreads, old worn out pillows and sheets, linoleum flooring in the kitchen and baths - all gave us the feeling of staying in an older person's condo, not at a riverside resort that cost over $250 a night.
reviews.title: A lovely and hospitable stay

reviews.text: It also appears that the innkeepers have changed the cleaning requirements for the cabin guests and that is a good thing. Since at the end of our stay we were required to strip the beds, remove all towels, unload the dishwasher and do all other dishes and remove all food. Whew...I was ready for a vacation from my vacation that morning. Now it looks like they just ask you to clean the dishes, which is fine, but I thought having to strip the beds was a bit much to ask when also charging me a "cleaning fee."
reviews.title: Our Favorite!

description: On the banks of the famous Big Thompson River is a charming historic B&B with family Cabins, just 3 minutes from Estes Park Colorado. All cabins and rooms have clean, bubbling private hot tubs and great beds, some have Sleep Number beds. A country style Breakfast for the B&B guests is a treat, with your special needs considered (cabins have kitchens, no breakfast). Close to RMNP. Beautiful scenery great fishing and lots of privacy in this small family run resort. Perfect for romantic getaways, family vacations, adventure, reunions. Free wifi, parking, fishing and firepits; we guarantee if you like "Old Colorado" style you will love it here. We even have a riverside massage house. We do the best economical weddings around, with an onside officiant. And pets are Welcome!
